answers.answer: Hi,If you have numbness in only one particular position, in most probability, it is due to pressure/compression on a nerve or blood vessel. Smoking can cause peripheral vascular disease. Spinal stenosis also could have progressed. Also, general disease like diabetes, hypothyroid, Vitamin B deficiency, alcoholism also need to be ruled out.Regards
Thanks...last night ok...might be related to my hefty exercises.  One time thing.Odd...Walt

question: The past two nights I have been awakened by right arm numbness.  Tonight, I could not ease the tingling/painin any horizontal position, so arose and within a few minutes it is now gone, though I feel a residue in my right arm.I do have spinal stenosis and have been doing many back and leg exercises which, together w/ Ibuprofen and an occasional muscle relaxant, have helped.  I am on my feet many hours a day and I also play tennis, and my healthis very good, otherwise.  Why would I have this pain (two nights now) and only in a horizontal position?I take no prescription drugs except Lipitor (10 mg every other day for years).
title: Numbness in right arm
